question_sentence: The current Lunar New Year celebration is marked by which animal in the Chinese zodiac calendar?
evidence: The world rang in the Year of the Horse on February 17 — the first day of the Lunar New Year festivities.

question_sentence: A football-field-sized avalanche overtook a group of backcountry skiers in which state this week?
evidence: At least eight skiers were killed in what is now the deadliest avalanche in California’s recorded history, authorities said.

question_sentence: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was arrested on Thursday on suspicion of misconduct in public office. Who is his older brother?
evidence: Britain’s former Prince Andrew, younger brother of King Charles III, was arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office. Police previously said they were reviewing claims that Andrew shared sensitive information with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein while serving as UK trade envoy.

question_sentence: Which airline experienced an emergency this week that temporarily shut down Newark airport?
evidence: Smoke in a JetBlue aircraft cabin forced passengers to evacuate on the taxiway, temporarily shutting down Newark airport on Wednesday.

question_sentence: Local lawmakers created a committee this week to examine "allegations of criminal activity" at Jeffrey Epstein’s Zorro Ranch, located in which state?
evidence: New Mexico’s House of Representatives passed a measure aimed at investigating a ranch that the late sex offender owned in the state.

question_sentence: Pioneering civil rights icon Rev. Jesse Jackson died this week at age 84. Which political office did he run for in the 1980s?
evidence: Rev. Jesse Jackson ran two electrifying presidential campaigns in the 1980s, but never held elected office.

question_sentence: What is the name of the organization that President Donald Trump created to resolve global conflicts?
evidence: President Trump convened the inaugural meeting of his Board of Peace in Washington, DC, on Thursday. Initially created to oversee the reconstruction of the Gaza Strip, the controversial board has since expanded to address conflicts worldwide.

question_sentence: Which tech billionaire testified before a jury this week about the safety of social media?
evidence: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Wednesday testified before a jury for the first time about accusations that social media platforms, including Instagram, harm children’s mental health.

question_sentence: Which type of celestial display was visible in part of the sky this week?
evidence: A “ring of fire” solar eclipse was visible over parts of the world this week, marking the first eclipse of 2026.

question_sentence: Tyler Reddick recently won NASCAR’s “Great American Race”, held annually in which state?
evidence: Reddick won the Daytona 500, held every February in Daytona Beach, Florida. The driver notched a victory for the racing team owned by basketball legend Michael Jordan.
